bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 1 (Thursday, January 3, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. BURGESS:H.R. 109.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8, Clause 4 of the Constitution of theUnited States: To Establish an uniform Rule ofNaturalization.[Page H214]

item.name: Immigration Integrity, Security, and Enforcement Subcommittee
Immigration Integrity, Security, and Enforcement Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Citizenship.
Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

summary.text:
Equal Protection for American Workers Act

This bill prohibits the Department of Homeland Security from granting work authorization to an alien who has been determined in a valid immigration proceeding to have been at any time unlawfully present in the United States.

bill.title: Equal Protection for American Workers Act

item.title: Equal Protection for American Workers Act
To prohibit the Secretary of Homeland Security from granting a work authorization to an alien found to have been unlawfully present in the United States.
Equal Protection for American Workers Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Citizenship.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
